name: Chinese-style Steamed Eggplant with Soy Sauce and Sesame Oil
description: A common Chinese cold dish.  The idea is to scoop out the flesh after steaming and toss it in oil, vinegar, and whatever other seasonings you have on hand.
recipeIngredient: 1 large globe eggplant, or 2 long Chinese or Japanese eggplants
2 to 3 teaspoons Chinkiang rice vinegar, or any other rice vinegar
1 medium clove garlic, minced or grated with a microplane grater (about 1 teaspoon)

recipeInstructions.text: Halve eggplants and place in a steamer. Steam until flesh feels soft and saturated with moisture, about 20 minutes. Remove from steamer and let cool. When the eggplants are cool enough to handle, scoop out the flesh in long segments, leaving out as best you can the pockets of seeds in the eggplant.

Meanwhile, whisk together olive oil, sesame oil, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, 1/2 teaspoon salt, sugar, tahini, and chili oil. Toss the eggplant in the dressing, then taste add more salt, sugar, or vinegar as desired. Garnish with scallions, cilantro, and/or toasted sesame seeds.
